result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:07 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Justin Tyler Kilpela in court.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Justin Tyler Kilpela. INCLUDES 22CF487 and 22CM194. Set for PLEAS. Court reviews file. DE completed COMPAS but it has not yet been filed. Court resets PLEAS. ADA Ballo gives information regarding DE having contact with alleged victim. Adjourned: 3:11 PM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 30, 2022 at 04:00 pm.

The original document was titled: Report
The original history event date is: 10-06-2022
COMPAS assessment. olg
by N.G. Filed by DA office. arc

AMENDED 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nicole George except by electronic regarding joint child. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant is restricted from one-half mile radius from 1930 Brookstone Circle, Hudson, WI 54016. Failure to comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

- Defendant to remain at Onyx House and if required to leave, must give notice to Justice Services Center.

3:59 PM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Karl Anderson in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Justin Tyler Kilpela. Defendant Justin Tyler Kilpela in court. INCLUDES 22CF487 and 22CM194. Court reviews files. DA Anderson requests 45 days for DE to complete COMPAS. Court sets PLEAS. Atty. Dolfi requests bond modification regarding GPS condition. Court reviews letter from JSC regarding discharge from Salvation Army. Court modifies bond on 22CF487. Adjourned: 4:14 PM. kma
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Pre-trial/scheduling conference on September 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
filed by ADA Ballo. bph

AMENDED 

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Nicole George except by telephone for purposes of child custody arrangements.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

- Defendant shall contact Kara Rheingans, Case Manager - Behavioral Health at 715-716-0920 upon release. Ms. Rheingans shall conduct an intake screening to determine appropriateness for inclusion in programming offered by Behavioral Health. If you are screened in for services, you shall participate in programming as recommended. Failure to contact Ms. Rheingans or participate may be considered a violation of your bond.

- I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to be fitted with a GPS monitoring device with restriction of one-half mile radius from 1930 Brookstone Circle, Hudson, WI 54016. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must IMMEDIATELY report to the Justice Support Center located adjacent to the lower parking lot of the St. Croix County Government Center. 

If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day. 

- Defendant may retrieve personal belongings ONE TIME in the presence of law enforcement. 

- Defendant to be transported directly from St. Croix County Jail to Salvation Army in Minneapolis, MN. Defendant to reside at Salvation Army through the completion on programming. If Defendant leaves or is discharged from programming, State and Court to be notified immediately. 

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.

10:08 AM CO: SJN, RPR: V. Deiss, Clerk: K. Anderson, Attorney Michael Becker in court for State of Wisconsin, Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Justin Tyler Kilpela, Defendant Justin Tyler Kilpela in court, in custody. INCLUDES 22CF487 (ARGN) and 22CM194 (PTC). Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Waives reading. NG. Court notes previously scheduled hearings. Atty. Dolfi states that DE has been accepted into Salvation Army programming, requests bond modification in 22CF487. State objects. Court modifies bond in 22CF487. Court sets SETC and PSC on 22CM194. Adjourned: 10:19 AM. kma
Filed by DDA Ellenwood. km

01:28 PM CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: ChristiansonProsecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Justin Tyler Kilpela. Defendant Justin Tyler Kilpela appeared by video, in custody. Court reviews case. Atty Dolfi states DE has treatment set up at Salvation Army and will be able to provide transportation today. Court will not address bond today as Victim has not been notified and a Branch 1 matter. Adjourned.

10:34 AM Crt Comm: Timothy C. Heckmann, RPR: Unmonitored DAR, Clk: B Harris, Prosecuting attorney Erica Ellenwood with Intern Conner Smith in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Justin Tyler Kilpela in court, in custody.  Attorney Abrianna Dolfi in court for Justin Tyler Kilpela. S/T of Officer Andrew Traeger Hudson PD.  Direct by Intern Conner Smith.  Cross by Atty Dolfi.  Redirect by Intern Smith. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.  Atty Dolfi states willing to do an ARGN today if the State can do it.  ADA Ellenwood requesting more time and to do ARGN with Branch 1. 22CM487 to be scheduled as PTC to trail this matter.  Atty Dolfi requesting to modify bond, states DE has a bed open at Salvation Army.  ADA Ellenwood would like confirmation from Salvation Army before agreeing to modifying bond.  Court will have this matter scheduled for 1:00 today to go over bond request.  Adjourned at 10:49 AM. bph
Arraignment scheduled for August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Arraignment on August 5, 2022 at 10:00 am.
